Current supported annotations:

  • circle
  • ellipse
  • point
  • polyline
  • rectangle
{% raw %}

read_annotations[source]

read_annotations(annotations_file, files_source, category_id='category')

Reads a VIA annotations file. Supports JSON and CSV file format. annotations_file: the path to the annotation file to read files_source: the path to the folder containing the source files category_id: the ID of the category label return: the file annotations

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

write_annotations[source]

write_annotations(annotations_file, file_annotations, category_id='category')

Writes a VIA annotations file. Supports JSON and CSV file format. annotations_file: the path to the annotation file to write file_annotations: the file annotations to write category_id: the ID of the category label

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

create_annotation_id[source]

create_annotation_id(file_path)

Creates a VIA annotation ID file_path: the file_path to create the ID from return: the ID if file exist, else None

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

get_annotation_for_file[source]

get_annotation_for_file(file_annotations, file_path)

Finds VIA annotation to a file_path file_annotations: the file annotations to search in file_path: the file_path to search for return: the annotation if found, else None

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

VIA Annotation Tool v1

Read or write annotation files made with the VIA Annotation Tool v1. Supported annotation file format are JSON and CSV.

Helper Methods

{% raw %}

configure_logging[source]

configure_logging(logging_level=20)

Configures logging for the system.

:param logging_level: The logging level to use.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Run from command line

To run the data-set builder from command line, use the following command: python -m mlcore.annotation.via [parameters]

The following parameters are supported:

  • [annotation]: The path to the VIA annotation file (e.g.: imagesets/segmentation/car_damage/via_region_data.json)
  • --files_source: The path to the folder containing the source files (e.g.: imagesets/segmentation/car_damage/trainval)
